dsl

Class Server<P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • dsl.Server<P>

  • public class Server<P>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  Server.RunStatus
      Enumerates the possible states of the Server, that is, whether it is running, stopped or aborted (abruptly stopped).

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The queue of actors available to perform a protocol round.

      The communications protocol implementation to be used.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> initialAddressMap
      The list of addresses for characters that is fixed for all runs of the protocol.

      The map of run IDs to the objects performing the run.

      The part to be interpreted by this Server object.
      private Server.RunStatus status
      Current state of the server.
      private java.lang.Thread[] threadPool
      The pool of threads in which actors are running (one Thread, one Actor).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(Part part,
              CommunicationResource<P> communicationResource,
              java.util.function.Supplier<A> actorFactory,
              int size)
        Creates a new Server object to interpret the protocol Part given using a certain CommunicationsResource.
        Type Parameters:
        A - the Actor type to be used by this Server.
        Parameters:
        part - the Part to be interpreted by the Server.
        communicationResource - the resource to be used to send and receive messages.
        actorFactory - a factory to instantiate new Actors (and do any necessary setup before running).
        size - the maximum number of actors that can run simultaneously.

    • Method Detail

      • buildThread

        private java.lang.Thread buildThread(int id,
                                     Actor<?> actor)
        Creates a new Thread object to run an Actor.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the Actor.
        actor - the Actor object to be run by the thread.
        Returns:
        an inactive Thread object (invoke Thread.start() to start the thread).

      • freshRunEvent

        private boolean freshRunEvent(FullMessage<P> inMessage)
        This method is an event handler to identify and process new runs of the given protocol that arrive through the communication resource given.
        Parameters:
        inMessage - an incoming message.
        Returns:
        true if the message belongs to a valid new run; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ReceiveEvent

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the Server.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the server. This only prevents the server from accepting new rounds and does not affect the ones already running.

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Aborts the server. Existing rounds will be forced to stop by interrupting all running threads. No new rounds will be accepted.

      • setInitialAddress

        public void setInitialAddress(java.lang.String identifier,
                              java.lang.String address)
        Sets the address of a character in the initialAddressMap. This address is the one (and the only one) that will be used by all protocol runs. The idea here is to either restrict the addresses that can perform a certain character or to set addresses that have to be known beforehand (e.g. a server address).
        Parameters:
        identifier - the character whose address is being set
        address - the address to be set for the character

      • getInitialAddress

        public java.lang.String getInitialAddress(java.lang.String identifier)
        Gets the address for the given character in the initialAddressMap.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the character for which the address is to be given.
        Returns:
        the address set for the character or null, in case none is set.
